intro: Schizoglossum whytei, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to conserve water, typical of xerophytic species. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms during the summer months. Schizoglossum whytei plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky soils and crevices.
